alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 11:12AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STORM SYSTEM EXPECTED TO BRING INCREASED WINDS AND SURF TO COASTAL BRISTOL BAY WEDNESDAY... A frontal system moving southward through the Bering Wednesday morning is expected to bring increased winds and surf to coastal Bristol Bay. This is a change from what most of the summer has been so far with tranquil conditions. Winds are expected to increase out of the south Wednesday morning throughout Bristol Bay. Winds are expected to peak between 35-45 mph (30-40kts) during the late morning to early afternoon hours as well as change direction to more southwesterly. Winds are expected to slowly diminish during the late afternoon and early evening hours Wednesday as the frontal system continues moving southward. As a result, expecting an increase in surf to near or slightly above (up to 1 foot) the highest astronomical tide especially between Togiak and Cape Constantine. Due to this, some very minor coastal flooding is possible Wednesday morning/afternoon. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc.
